para.para: Functions to do molecular mechanics.

section.para: Definition at line 329 of file model_mechanics.cpp.

section.title: model_angle_energy()

para.computeroutput: double model_angle_energy (Bmodel * model, Bmodparam & md)

para.para: Calculates the model angular energy.

entry.para: model parameters with reference angle specifications.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: double angular energy. The angular potential is a harmonic function: E = Ka*(a - a0)^2 The force is zero when a = reference angle (a0). Only the first model in the linked list is used.

section.para: Definition at line 937 of file model_mechanics.cpp.

section.title: model_average_linklength()

para.computeroutput: double model_average_linklength (Bmodel * model)

section.para: Definition at line 1666 of file model_mechanics.cpp.

section.title: model_calculate_deviations()[1/2]

para.computeroutput: int model_calculate_deviations (Bmodel * model)

para.para: Calculates the deviations from regularity in a polyhedral model.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: int 0. Link deviation: d = sqrt(sum((l - l0)^2)/n) where l is the length and l0 is the reference length. Angle deviation: d = sqrt(sum((a - a0)^2)/n) where a is the angle between two links and a0 is the reference angle: a0 = PI*(1 - 2/v) where v is the number of vertices in the associated polygon. Only the first model in the linked list is used.

section.title: model_distance_energy()

para.computeroutput: double model_distance_energy (Bmodel * model, Bmodparam & md)

para.para: Calculates the distance-related potentials between components.

entry.para: model parameters with distance interactions specifications.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: double distance energy. Distance potential types: 0 none 1 harmonic - only for explicit links 2 soft 3 Lennard-Jones 4 Morse Only the first model in the linked list is used.

section.para: Definition at line 1231 of file model_mechanics.cpp.

section.title: model_lennard_jones_energy()

para.computeroutput: double model_lennard_jones_energy (Bmodel * model, double Kd, double d0)

para.para: Calculates the Lennard-Jones potential between components.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: double distance energy. The Lennard-Jones potential is given by: E = Kd*((d0/d)^12 - 2*(d0/d)^6) The force is zero when d = d0. The potential is set to zero for d > 3*d0; Only the first model in the linked list is used.

entry.para: model parameters with distance interactions specifications.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: double distance energy. The link potential is a harmonic function: E = Kl*(d - l0)^2 The force is zero when d = reference link length (l0). Only the first model in the linked list is used.

section.title: model_mechanics()

para.computeroutput: double model_mechanics (Bmodel * model, Bmodparam & md, int mm_type, int max_iter, double max_shift, double velocitylimit)

para.para: Minimizes the energy of a model.

entry.para: limit on velocity per time step.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: double final energy. The inclusion of energy terms is based on positive K-constants in the model parameter structure. Only the first model in the linked list is used.

section.para: Definition at line 40 of file model_mechanics.cpp.

section.title: model_minimize()

para.computeroutput: int model_minimize (Bmodel * model, double max_shift)

para.para: Move components random distances down the energy gradient.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: int number of components. The distance of movement is limited to the maximum shift. Only the first model in the linked list is used.

section.para: Definition at line 222 of file model_mechanics.cpp.

section.title: model_morse_energy()

para.computeroutput: double model_morse_energy (Bmodel * model, double Kd, double d0)

para.para: Calculates the Morse potential between components.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: double distance energy. The Morse potential is given by: E = Kd*((1-exp((a/d0)*(d0-d)))^2 - 1) The width of the energy well is given by a, set here to 6. The force is zero when d = d0. The potential is set to zero for d > 3*d0; Only the first model in the linked list is used.

section.para: Definition at line 854 of file model_mechanics.cpp.

section.title: model_neighbor_distance_energy()

para.computeroutput: double model_neighbor_distance_energy (Bmodel * model, Bmodparam & md)

para.para: Calculates the distance-related potentials between components and their neighbors.

entry.para: model parameters with distance interactions specifications.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: double distance energy. Distance potential types: 0 none 1 harmonic - only for explicit links 2 soft 3 Lennard-Jones 4 Morse Only the first model in the linked list is used.

section.para: Definition at line 728 of file model_mechanics.cpp.

section.title: model_neighbor_plane_energy()

para.computeroutput: double model_neighbor_plane_energy (Bmodel * model, double Kplane)

para.para: Calculates the planarity energy and forces with respect to neighbors.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: double neighbor planar energy. A plane is fit through the neigbor locations and the normal calculated from: n•p = d where n is the normal vector, p is a point in the plane, and d is the offset. The deviation of a component location from the neighbor plane is calculated and converted to a harmonic energy and force. Only the first model in the linked list is used.

section.para: Definition at line 1128 of file model_mechanics.cpp.

section.title: model_point_force()

para.computeroutput: double model_point_force (Bmodel * model, Vector3< double > point, double Kpoint, double decay)

para.para: Calculates the forces and energy resulting from a single point force.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: double point force energy. The energy is defined as an exponential decay over distance from the center of the point force: Ep = Kp * exp(-decay*dist) The force is the derivative of the energy: Fp = Kp * decay * dir * exp(-decay*dist) where Kp is the point force constant, dist is the distance of the component from the center of the point force, decay is the energy decay with distance from the point force center, and dir is the normalized direction vector pointing from the point force center to the component, indicating the direction of force. Only the first model in the linked list is used.

section.para: Definition at line 1175 of file model_mechanics.cpp.

section.title: model_polygon_angle_energy()

para.computeroutput: double model_polygon_angle_energy (Bmodel * model, double Kpolyangle)

para.para: Calculates the link angular forces and energy.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: double total link angle energy. The energy is defined as a harmonic function around the reference link angle, a0: Ea = Ka*(cos(a0)-r1*r2/(|r1|*|r2|))^2 Ea = Ka*(a0 - a)^2 The force is the derivative of the energy on the first and last atoms: Fa1 = 2*Ka*(cos(a0)-r1*r2/(|r1|*|r2|))/(|r1|*|r2|) * ((r1*r2/|r1|)*r1-r2) Fa3 = 2*Ka*(cos(a0)-r1*r2/(|r1|*|r2|))/(|r1|*|r2|) * ((r1*r2/|r2|)*r2-r1) where r1 is the vector from atom 2 to atom 1, r2 is the vector from atom 2 to atom 3, and Ka is the link angle force constant. Only the first model in the linked list is used.

section.para: Definition at line 985 of file model_mechanics.cpp.

section.title: model_polygon_energy()[1/2]

para.computeroutput: double model_polygon_energy (Bmodel * model, double Kpoly)

para.para: Calculates the polygon regularity energy and forces.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: double polygon energy. Given the distances of all the vertices from the polygon center, the polygon regularity is defined as the deviation of these distances from the average distance: E = Kp*(d - d0) Only the first model in the linked list is used.

section.para: Definition at line 1073 of file model_mechanics.cpp.

section.title: model_polygon_energy()[2/2]

para.computeroutput: double model_polygon_energy (Bmodel * model, double linklength, double Kpoly)

para.para: Calculates the polygon regularity.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: double polygon energy. Given the distances of all the vertices from the polygon center, the polygon regularity is defined as the deviation of these distances from the reference distance: E = Kp*(d - d0) where the reference distance is calculated from the link length: d0 = l0/sqrt(2*(1-cos(2PI/n)) where n is the polygon order. Only the first model in the linked list is used.

section.para: Definition at line 1025 of file model_mechanics.cpp.

section.title: model_polygon_plane_energy()

para.computeroutput: double model_polygon_plane_energy (Bmodel * model, double Kpolyplane)

para.para: Calculates the polygon planarity energy and forces.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: double polygon planar energy. A plane is fit through the polygon vertices and the normal calculated from: n•p = d where n is the normal vector, p is a point in the plane, and d is the offset. The polygon plane energy is calculated as a harmonic deviation from the fitted plane. Only the first model in the linked list is used.

formalpara.title: Returns

para.para: Calculates the potential between a components and a point.

entry.para: reference distance between component and point.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: double energy. The radial potential is given by: E = Kd*(d - d0)^2 The force is zero when d = d0. Only the first model in the linked list is used.

section.para: Definition at line 1696 of file model_mechanics.cpp.

section.title: model_soft_sphere_energy()

para.computeroutput: double model_soft_sphere_energy (Bmodel * model, double Kd, double d0)

para.para: Calculates the soft sphere potential between components.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: double distance energy. The soft sphere potential is given by: E = Kd*(d0/d)^12 The potential is set to zero for d > 3*d0; Only the first model in the linked list is used.

section.para: Definition at line 797 of file model_mechanics.cpp.

section.title: model_verlet()

para.computeroutput: double model_verlet (Bmodel * model, double timestep, double Kfriction, double velocitylimit)

para.para: Model dynamics using the velocity verlet integrator.

entry.para: limit on velocity per time step.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: double kinetic energy. Leapfrog integration for any coordinate x, velocity vx and force Fx: x(t+1) = x(t) + vx(t+1) * dt vx(t+1) = (Fx(t) * dt/m + vx(t)) * kf where kf: friction constant (1=no friction) dt: time step m: atomic mass The velocity is limited each time step to damp chaotic oscillations. Only the first model in the linked list is used.

section.para: Definition at line 261 of file model_mechanics.cpp.

section.title: model_zero_forces()

para.computeroutput: int model_zero_forces (Bmodel * model)

para.para: Zeroes the component forces.

formalpara.para: int number of components. Only the first model in the linked list is used.
